item.title: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015
Providing for a correction in the enrollment of H.R. 83.

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 212 (Roll no. 561). (text: CR H9065)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 214 - 212 (Roll no. 561).(text: CR H9065)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H9074)
DEBATE - The House resumed with debate on H. Res. 776.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 776.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H9065-9075)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 150.

The rule provides for consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 83. Section 2 of the rule provides that upon adoption of motion specified in section 1, H. Con. Res. 122 shall be considered as adopted.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-655, by Mr. Cole.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-655, by Mr. Cole.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 83) to require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes; waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 83) to require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes; waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules; and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 83) to require the Secretary of the Interior to assemble a team of technical, policy, and financial experts to address the energy needs of the insular areas of the United States and the Freely Associated States through the development of energy action plans aimed at promoting access to affordable, reliable energy, including increasing use of indigenous clean-energy resources, and for other purposes; waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
